intro: Amblyanthera lasiocarpa var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy amblyanthera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its specific variety name "pubescens." Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with a distinctive appearance that sets it apart from other members of the genus. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
